xml.name: Code Navigation
xml.Text: When working on your project, you often need to open and edit a specific class, file, or symbol. The fastest way to do this is to use the main navigation triple: Go to Class/File/Symbol.
xml.Try: Let's navigate to the DetailViewController class. Press GotoClass, type dvc, and then press EditorEnter.
xml.Text: Each of the Go to... dialogs allows using fuzzy matching, so you can type only a part of the name of a class, file, or symbol in order to find it.
xml.Try: Nice! Now let's open the AppDelegate.swift file: press GotoFile, type ad and press EditorEnter.
Let's jump directly to the detailViewController declaration in the MasterViewController class. Press GotoSymbol, type dvc, and then press EditorEnter.
xml.Text: If you also need to include standard libraries and other non-project files, symbols, or classes, just press the shortcut twice.
xml.Try: Another important action from the Go to... family is Go to Declaration. Place the caret at DetailViewController? and press GotoDeclaration to jump to its declaration.
If a method or class has several implementations, GotoDeclaration will get you to the first one. Try using GotoImplementation to see all the definitions of UIViewController.
Let's navigate back to Navigation.swift via GotoFile.
Go to Super Definition navigates you to the parent class declaration. Press GotoSuperMethod to jump to the JetBrainsIDE class.
Now press GotoSuperMethod again to jump to the IDEProtocol protocol declaration.

Finally, there are two very useful and frequently used navigation actions that can help you quickly switch between recent files and toolwindows. First up is the Recent files popup. Open it via RecentFiles and select what you need using the arrow keys on the keyboard.

The second is Switcher, which looks the same but immediately disappears after you select something. Hold the ⌃ key while pressing Switcher, and press it again to switch to select some file or toolwindow. Release the ⌃ key after you've selected what you wanted.
